perturbation.original_text:
14. Terms of Payments
14.1
Contractor will invoice Customer per each delivery or as provided in Sections 6 and 8 hereinabove. The invoice shall include all purchase
order details. The invoice will be quoted in US Dollars.
14.2
Contractor and Customer agree to terms of payments of current plus thirty (30) days from the date of invoice. Payment shall be affected in US
Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
14. Terms of Payments
14.1
Contractor will invoice Customer per each delivery or as provided in Sections 6 and 8 hereinabove. The invoice shall include all purchase
order details. The invoice will be quoted in US Dollars.
14.2
Contractor and Customer agree to terms of payments of current plus sixty (60) days from the date of invoice. Payment shall be affected in US
Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by changing the payment terms from 'current plus thirty (30) days' to 'current plus sixty (60) days'. This creates uncertainty regarding the actual deadline for payments and could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
6.3
Long Lead Items
In order to manage demand fluctuations Contractor shall suggest from time to time a list of LLI’s to be approved by the Customer. Contractor
shall maintain in inventory certain quantities of LLI. “LLI” shall mean Long Lead Item materials required in order to complete manufacture and
supply of Products. For the avoidance of doubt Customer shall have no additional liability with respect to the holding of LLI other than the
liability provided herein below.
The usage of LLI by Contractor for the manufacture of Items shall be by a written order by Customer in accordance with this Agreement,
stipulating the quantity Customer wishes Contractor to use. If Contractor holds LLIs based on any written requirement for more than three
(3) months, Customer shall be required to purchase such LLIs at their direct costs plus a handling fee of 2% of Product price. The purchase
terms of such LLI’s, set forth in Section 8.2 hereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.3
Long Lead Items
In order to manage demand fluctuations Contractor shall suggest from time to time a list of LLI’s to be approved by the Customer. Contractor
shall maintain in inventory certain quantities of LLI. “LLI” shall mean Long Lead Item materials required in order to complete manufacture and
supply of Products. For the avoidance of doubt Customer shall have no additional liability with respect to the holding of LLI other than the
liability provided herein below.
The usage of LLI by Contractor for the manufacture of Items shall be by a written order by Customer in accordance with this Agreement,
stipulating the quantity Customer wishes Contractor to use. If Contractor holds LLIs based on any written requirement for more than six
(6) months, Customer shall be required to purchase such LLIs at their direct costs plus a handling fee of 2% of Product price. The purchase
terms of such LLI’s, set forth in Section 8.2 hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The change modifies the period after which the customer is obliged to purchase the Long Lead Items (LLIs) from three months to six months. This directly contradicts the original agreement and creates confusion regarding when the customer's financial obligation to purchase the LLIs arises, leading to potential disputes about inventory management and payment responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text:
7.4.2
When Customer draws from the FGI, Contractor shall replenish the FGI no later than sixty (60) days from such date that Customer
draws from FGI, provided the drawing of FGI shall be by the issuance of a written order by Customer in accordance with this
Agreement, stipulating the quantity Customer wishes to withdraw from the FGI.
7.4.3
If Contractor holds any FGI based on any forecast for more than three (3) months from the original delivery date specified in the
applicable purchase order, Customer shall be required to purchase any and all such goods from Contractor for 100% of Contract
Price of such goods and Section 8.3 below shall not apply.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.4.2
When Customer draws from the FGI, Contractor shall replenish the FGI no later than thirty (30) days from such date that Customer
draws from FGI, provided the drawing of FGI shall be by the issuance of a written order by Customer in accordance with this
Agreement, stipulating the quantity Customer wishes to withdraw from the FGI.
7.4.3
If Contractor holds any FGI based on any forecast for more than six (6) months from the original delivery date specified in the
applicable purchase order, Customer shall be required to purchase any and all such goods from Contractor for 100% of Contract
Price of such goods and Section 8.3 below shall not apply.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces contradictory terms related to the Finished Goods Inventory (FGI). In section 7.4.2, the replenishment time is changed from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days, requiring faster restocking. Simultaneously, section 7.4.3 extends the holding period before mandatory customer purchase from three (3) months to six (6) months. This creates a conflict between the urgency to replenish the FGI and the extended timeframe for the customer to be obligated to buy the held inventory, which can cause disagreements over inventory levels and financial commitments.
